column5: So, I found this epic "looking" shore spot. Decided to check it out this evening with my bro in law, son and two of his friends.  I figured as the sun set it would be perfect for pike/bass.  But, the kiddos came up with this 30 minute derby idea, to which I agreed.  Me and my bro in law took a seat and let the kiddos have at er!  Biggest fish of any legal species took bragging rights!  It was so fun to watch them running running shorelines, docks, re tying baits/lures, trying to sabotage each other lol.  30 mins and no fish landed as a cold front moved in, unfortunately.  So we went to a 5 minute overtime.  One kiddo landed a pike, maybe 24-26" in the last minute for the win!  I had an absolute blast watching and it was alot of fun! They all had access to my tackle bag just to make things fair.  All the kids were asking if we could do it again tomorrow lol  If I can figure out how to post the pics I will(some are awesome!)  If I cant, can someone shoot me a pm of their email to post?  Anyways, what a wicked fun time!
This is a great story. Love hearing stuff like this that keeps the kids entertained and gets them into fishing.  Can't wait to hear how round 2 goes

It was a great time! But if round two goes down today it's gonna be mid day to give them a better chance at landing fish.  It went from +25 at 5pm to only +10 at 8pm, waaa√†y too much of a cool down.  I was hoping it stayed warm because it was a beautiful sunny day and I figured the top water bite was gonna be on fire.  The kid(Joey) that won is a natural. He's been fishing for a month and has a wicked cast with a baitcasters. First thing he tied on was a chatterbait, and im thinking this kid knows what's up lol  He did get one gnarly backlash so I showed him how to get that out. Showed them a few new knots too and how to properly handle a northern.

Rick I recently signed up for imgur and it's real simple and easy to use. Not many pictures yet though but here's my garlic harvest this year. Just clicked copy on bbcode and pasted here. Easy resizing too.
